tool.name: Atlas FASTQ provider
tool.description: Retrieval and download of FASTQ files from ENA and other repositories such as HCA. The tool is used in production pipelines of EMBL-EBI Expression Atlas and Single Cell Expression Atlas.
tool.command: fetchFastq.sh -f '$source' -t '$target' #if $resource -s '$resource' #end if #if $retrieval_method -m '$retrieval_method' #end if #if $mode -p '$mode' #end if #if $library -l '$library' #end if #if $config_file -c '$config_file' #end if #if $validate_only -v '$validate_only' #end if #if $download_type -d '$download_type' #end if

param.name: resource
param.label: resource or directory, default 'auto'
param.help: How to fetch the file, e.g. thereâ€™s a specific method for getting results from the Human Cell Atlas' 'Azul' resource.

param.name: retrieval_method
param.label: retrieval method, default 'wget'
param.help: retrieval method, default 'auto'. Files with hca source will use the 'hca' download method regardless (-m has no effect). Private ENA files will be fetched via 'ssh' (-m has no effect). The 'http' method refers to an HTTP endpoint in the EBI Fire resource.

param.name: mode
param.label: public or private, default public. Private usable by EBI staff only

param.name: library
param.label: ENA library (ENA source files only), by default inferred from file name
param.help: library, by default inferred from file name. E.g. -l ERR1888646

param.name: validate_only
param.label: validate only to check a source URI is valid, don't download

param.name: download_type
param.label: download type, fastq or SRA file

tool.help: Usage: fetchFastq.sh [-f <file or uri>] [-t <target file>] [-s <source resource or directory, default 'auto'>] [-m <retrieval method, default 'auto'>] [-p <public or private, default 'public'>] [-l <library, by default inferred from file name>] [-c <config file to override defaults>] [-v <validate only, don't download>] [-d <download type, 'fastq' or 'srr'>]
